fields.description:
While using the Eucalyptus Windows Integration tool when creating a Windows 2008 Datacenter image, the installation of the GPL PV Drivers for Windows Setup ends prematurely because of an error. From the error, it seems like no files were installed. It seems that once this error occurs, the tool says everything installed successfully. 

*Steps to Reproduce*

1) Create Windows 2008 Datacenter VM on CentOS 6.3, KVM 

2) Apply all Windows critical patches via Windows Update Service

3) Run Eucalyptus Windows Integration Tool

4) When selecting hypervisors, select "KVM, Xen, and VMware" (I also re-did this and just selected "KVM")

5) Observe GPL Error that comes up.

_Screen shots attached_
fields.summary: Eucalyptus Windows Integration Tool Gives Error on Install on Windows 2008 DataCenter (w/o Hyper-V)

comments.body:
Reproduced issue.

I uninstalled the tool, then re-installed the tool.  Arrived at the same error.

Did this about 5 times.

I checked again after shutting down (virsh destroy) the image, then starting it again (virsh create).  Before I started the VM back up again, I used libguestfs to extend the filesystem from 17 Gigs to 20 Gigs to rule out disk size issues.  Still same error, but you could see the VirtIO enabled devices in Device Management.  _Screen shot attached_
Screen shot of VirtIO devices.

This is a known problem (at least to me). The issue is that you were installing gplpv which is the guest driver for xen. There's an issue with gplpv windows installer where it hangs when underlying hypervisor is not xen. The guest should be ok since virtio drivers are installed. However I admit this is confusing and not a good user experience. One way to solve the problem is that we allow users to choose only one hypervisor during the installation. That might preclude the use case where people deploy windows images on multiple hypervisors..
Thanks for the reply Sang-min.  Question - should it have skipped the Active Directory configuration part?
Ad configuration is not during the installation. You should run the tool in programs menu.
Thanks Sang-min.  I will update this ticket accordingly.

1. Did you run bcdedit to ignore driver signing  then reboot ?
   That is when I've seen that popup warning about 
   driver signing.

2. FWIIW Windows has an annoying habit of keeping drivers
   around even if a software package is removed, so 
   running the remove/reinstall phase may have little
   effect.
For 3.2, should we review updating the docs if we aren't going to change tool behavior?  Seems this leaves the user with a bad experience.
moving to investigating to be reviewed in eng-support bug scrub.
If I recall from last week's meeting, we were going to link this to a DOC issue to be added to the known issue's list. Did this occur?  Aaron please let us know if we need to follow-up on this one.

[~jdonnelly], can you provide the location to the latest version of this tool?

Harold, please work with John to get the latest and verify if you can workaround this issue by following the steps John outlined in 12/10 comments.  

If this works we need to add notes to the doc that outline these steps.

The latest windows ISO was is located at :

 http://mirror.qa.eucalyptus-systems.com/windows_images/iso/EucaWindowsService3.2.0.iso


Perhaps the install tool in the future can test for + then run this commands automatically :

{noformat}

  bcdedit.exe -set loadoptions DISABLE_INTEGRITY_CHECKS 
  bcdedit.exe -set TESTSIGNING ON

{noformat}

 Then reboot to ensure these options are set . Without these enabled on
certain X64 platforms the unsigned drivers will never be loaded. 

These steps are in the user guide. I don't think any additional actions are 
needed other than to perhaps add a note to the release docs.

I see the same hang with only "KVM" ticked to be installed and under the KVM hypervisor. 
I have also run bcdedit commands and rebooted, but still see the hang. 

Not sure what's going on yet.
This warning message no longer appears  3.2.1 built. It has been commented out.
While working sup-213 this issue is resolved.

New Windows ISO :

http://mirror.qa.eucalyptus-systems.com/windows_images/iso/EucaWindowsService3.2.1.iso

built EucaWindow-3.2.1.iso. 

Unit tested ok .
Removed the fix version as this does not apply to Eucalyptus version 3.2.1.

added a zip file of the iso contents:

http://mirror.qa.eucalyptus-systems.com/windows_images/iso/eucaWin3.2.1.zip

*Update*

Community posting on workaround for this issue:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/windows-integration/issues/2

Verified on win8, 64, sp2. Did not see this error or any other functional errors in the 3.3.1 rc ver of the tool. 
Thanks,
-M
